00022 /**
00023  * @file   QuantMethodGTypeCHPReport.cpp
00024  * @author Chuck Sugnet
00025  * @date   Wed Mar 15 23:01:47 2006
00026  * 
00027  * @brief Reporter for genotyping probe sets that outputs chp files. There is
00028  * one CHP file produced for each cel file and the order of the CHP file is
00029  * guarenteed to be the same as the cdf file. It is very important that the
00030  * number and order of the probeset results is the exact same as the CDF
00031  * file. There have been a number of high impact bugs on this front and it is
00032  * important to be very careful.
00033  */
00034 
00035 //
00036 #include "chipstream/QuantMethodGTypeCHPReport.h"
00037 //
00038 #include "stats/stats.h"
00039 #include "util/Fs.h"
00040 
00041 using namespace affx;
00042 
00043 /** Swap out the .cel for .chp */
00044 void QuantMethodGTypeCHPReport::setupFileNames(const IntensityMart &iMart) 
00045 {
00046   /* If the chp files names are empty chip off cel suffix and add "algname.chp" */
00047   m_CELFileNames = iMart.getCelFileNames();
00048   if (m_CHPFileNames.size() == 0) {
00049     m_CHPFileNames = Fs::changeDirAndExt(m_Prefix,m_CELFileNames,"."+m_Info.m_AlgName+".chp");
00050   }
00051   if(m_CHPFileNames.size() != iMart.getCelFileNames().size()) 
00052     Err::errAbort("Must be same number of output CHP files (" + 
00053       ToStr(m_CHPFileNames.size()) + ") as input CEL files (" + ToStr(iMart.getCelFileNames().size()));
00054 }
00055 
00056 /** Fill in a chp header file info. */
00057 void QuantMethodGTypeCHPReport::setupChpFile(affxchpwriter::CCHPFileWriter &chp,
00058                                              AnalysisInfo &info) 
00059 {
00060         assert(info.m_ParamNames.size() == info.m_ParamValues.size());
00061         chp.SetAlgorithmName(info.m_AlgName.c_str());
00062         chp.SetAlgorithmVersion(info.m_AlgVersion.c_str());
00063         chp.SetProgID(info.m_ProgID.c_str());
00064         chp.AddAlgorithmParameter("program-name", info.m_ProgramName.c_str());
00065         chp.AddAlgorithmParameter("program-version", info.m_ProgramVersion.c_str());
00066         chp.AddAlgorithmParameter("program-company", info.m_ProgramCompany.c_str());
00067         for(unsigned int i = 0; i < info.m_ParamNames.size(); i++) 
00068         {
00069                 chp.AddAlgorithmParameter(info.m_ParamNames[i].c_str(), info.m_ParamValues[i].c_str());
00070         }
00071         // for(unsigned int i = 0; i < info.m_ClientInfoNames.size(); i++) 
00072         // {
00073         //      chp.AddAlgorithmAppMetaInfo(info.m_ClientInfoNames[i].c_str(), info.m_ClientInfoValues[i].c_str());
00074         // }
00075 
00076 }

00078 /** 
00079  * Get set up for a run of reporting probesets. Often used to open file
00080  * streams and print headers to files etc.
00081  * 
00082  * @param qMethod - Quantification method to be used.
00083  * @param layout - Where the probesets, probes, etc are on the chip.
00084  * 
00085  * @return true if success, false otherwise.
00086  */
00087 bool QuantMethodGTypeCHPReport::prepare(QuantMethod &qMethod, const IntensityMart &iMart) {
00088 
00089         setupFileNames(iMart);
00090   
00091         // Make sure our output directory exists.
00092         if (!Fs::isWriteableDir(m_Prefix.c_str()) &&
00093             (Fs::mkdirPath(m_Prefix, false) != APT_OK)) {
00094           APT_ERR_ABORT("Can't make or write to directory: " + m_Prefix);
00095         }
00096 
00097         // Prepare headers for all CHP files.
00098     Verbose::progressBegin(1, "Initializing " + ToStr(m_CHPFileNames.size()) + " XDA CHP files", m_CHPFileNames.size(), 0, m_CHPFileNames.size());
00099         for(int i=0; i<m_CHPFileNames.size(); i++) 
00100         {
00101                 // Remove any existing CHP file
00102                 std::string chpName = m_CHPFileNames[i];
00103                 if(Fs::isReadable(chpName.c_str())) {
00104                   if(Fs::rm(chpName, false)){ 
00105                     Err::errAbort("Unable to remove old CHP file, " + chpName);
00106                   }
00107                 }
00108 
00109                 // Create tmp chp file
00110         Verbose::progressStep(1);
00111                 affxchpwriter::CCHPFileWriter chp;
00112     std::string tmp_name = m_CHPFileNames[i] + ".tmp";
00113     std::string tmp_unc_name=Fs::convertToUncPath(tmp_name);
00114                 chp.SetFileName(tmp_unc_name.c_str());
00115                 if(!chp.CreateNewFile()) 
00116                 {
00117                         Err::errAbort("QuantMethodGTypeCHPReport::prepare() - Can't open CHP file: "+
00118                     FS_QUOTE_PATH(tmp_unc_name)+" to write.");
00119                 }
00120                 chp.InitializeForWriting(
00121                         m_Info.m_NumRows, 
00122                         m_Info.m_NumCols, 
00123                         m_Info.m_NumProbeSets,
00124                         m_Info.m_ChipType.c_str(), 
00125                         m_Info.m_ProbeSetType, 
00126                         false);
00127                 std::string fileRoot = Fs::basename(m_CELFileNames[i]);
00128                 chp.SetParentCelFileName(fileRoot.c_str());
00129                 setupChpFile(chp, m_Info);
00130                 Err::check(chp.SaveHeader(), "QuantMethodGTypeCHPReport::prepare() - "
00131                "Couldn't save header for file '" + tmp_name);
00132                 chp.Close();
00133     m_FilesForWriter.push_back(tmp_name);
00134         }
00135   Verbose::progressEnd(1, "Done.");
00136 
00137         // Initialize genotype entry buffer writer.
00138         m_GenotypeEntryBufferWriter.Initialize(&m_FilesForWriter, true);        // true = Genotype
00139 
00140         return true;
00141 }
00142 
00143 /** 
00144  * After every probeset computation this function is called an is an opportunity
00145  * to query the quantification method for results, residuals, etc.
00146  * 
00147  * @param psGroup - List of probesets from which probes were used.
00148  * @param qMethod - Quantification method with compute method called.
00149  * @param layout - Where the probesets, probes, etc are on the chip.
00150  * 
00151  * @return true if success, false otherwise.
00152  */
00153 bool QuantMethodGTypeCHPReport::report(ProbeSetGroup &psGroup, 
00154                                        QuantMethod &qMethod, 
00155                                        const IntensityMart &iMart, 
00156                                        std::vector<ChipStream *> &iTrans, 
00157                                        PmAdjuster &pmAdjust) {
00158         QuantGTypeMethod *gMethod = dynamic_cast<QuantGTypeMethod *>(&qMethod);
00159         if(gMethod == NULL) { Err::errAbort("Can only use a QuantMethodGTypeReport with a QuantGTypeMethod."); }
00160         assert(psGroup.probeSets.size() > 0);
00161 
00162         // Check to make sure that we are getting probe sets in the right order.
00163         if(!Util::sameString(psGroup.probeSets[0]->name, m_Info.m_ProbesetNames[m_CurrentProbeSetCount])) 
00164         {
00165                 Err::errAbort("QuantMethodGTypeCHPReport::report() - Expecting probeset: " + 
00166                         ToStr(m_Info.m_ProbesetNames[m_CurrentProbeSetCount]) + ToStr(" got: ") +
00167                         ToStr(psGroup.probeSets[0]->name) + " at index: " + ToStr(m_CurrentProbeSetCount));
00168         }
00169 
00170         // Create a genotype CHP entry from analysis results.
00171         affxchp::CGenotypeProbeSetResults entry;
00172         for(int target=0; target<gMethod->getNumCalls(); target++) 
00173         {
00174         ///@todo should check that the call encoding is the expected GType encoding
00175                 GType call = GType_from_int(gMethod->getCall(target));
00176                 double confidence = gMethod->getConfidence(target);
00177                 // Translate our representation to the CHP call representation.
00178                 switch (call) 
00179                 {
00180                         case NN: entry.AlleleCall = ALLELE_NO_CALL; break;
00181                         case AA: entry.AlleleCall = ALLELE_A_CALL; break;
00182                         case AB: entry.AlleleCall = ALLELE_AB_CALL; break;
00183                         case BB: entry.AlleleCall = ALLELE_B_CALL; break;
00184                         default: Err::errAbort("Don't recognize call of type: " + ToStr(call));
00185                 }               
00186                 entry.Confidence = confidence;
00187 
00188                 /*  
00189                 We do not modify the following to take integer values since the accessor function
00190                 getConfGenotype accesses m_Distances which maintains data indexed by GType not int. 
00191                 */      
00192                 entry.pvalue_AA = gMethod->getConfGenotype(AA, target);
00193                 entry.pvalue_AB = gMethod->getConfGenotype(AB, target);
00194                 entry.pvalue_BB = gMethod->getConfGenotype(BB, target);
00195                 entry.pvalue_NoCall = gMethod->getConfGenotype(NN, target);
00196                 m_GenotypeEntryBufferWriter.WriteGenotypeEntry(target, entry);
00197   }
00198 
00199   m_CurrentProbeSetCount++;
00200 
00201   return true;
00202 }
00203 
00204 /** 
00205  * For genotyping CHP files GTYPE likes to have the median of the raw intensity
00206  * probes stuffed into the confidence field of the CHP files. I'm not sure why
00207  * but Richard C asked for it so here it is.
00208  * 
00209  * @param psGroup - Groupt of probes.
00210  * @param iMart - Raw intensity data for chips.
00211  * @param chipIx - Which chip we are taking the median for.
00212  * 
00213  * @return median of all raw intensities for the PM probes in psGroup.
00214  */
00215 float QuantMethodGTypeCHPReport::medianOfPmProbes(ProbeSetGroup &psGroup, const IntensityMart &iMart, int chipIx) {
00216   vector<float> pm;
00217   float med = 0;
00218   for(unsigned int psIx = 0; psIx < psGroup.probeSets.size(); psIx++) {
00219     const ProbeSet *ps = psGroup.probeSets[psIx];
00220     for(unsigned int atomIx = 0; atomIx < ps->atoms.size(); atomIx++) {
00221       Atom *a = ps->atoms[atomIx];
00222       for(unsigned int probeIx = 0; probeIx < a->probes.size(); probeIx++) {
00223         Probe *p = a->probes[probeIx];
00224         if(Probe::isPm(*p)) {
00225           pm.push_back(iMart.getProbeIntensity(p->id, chipIx));
00226         }
00227       }
00228     }
00229   }
00230   if(pm.empty()) {
00231     Err::errAbort("QuantMethodGTypeCHPReport::medianOfPmProbes() - No Pm Probes.");
00232   }
00233   med = median(pm.begin(), pm.end());
00234   return med;
00235 }
00236 
00237 /** 
00238  * If a probeset fails to compute for whatever reason then this method is
00239  * called rather than the normal report call above. By default does nothing.
00240  * 
00241  * @param psGroup - List of probesets from which probes were used.
00242  * @param qMethod - Quantification method with compute method called.
00243  * 
00244  * @return true if success, false otherwise.
00245  */
00246 bool QuantMethodGTypeCHPReport::reportFailure(ProbeSetGroup &psGroup, 
00247                                               QuantMethod &qMethod,
00248                                               const IntensityMart &iMart, 
00249                                               std::vector<ChipStream *> &iTrans, 
00250                                               PmAdjuster &pmAdjust) {
00251         QuantGTypeMethod *gMethod = dynamic_cast<QuantGTypeMethod *>(&qMethod);
00252         if(gMethod == NULL) { Err::errAbort("Can only use a QuantMethodGTypeReport with a QuantGTypeMethod."); }
00253         assert(psGroup.probeSets.size() > 0);
00254         // Check to make sure that we are getting probe sets in the right order.
00255         if(!Util::sameString(psGroup.probeSets[0]->name,m_Info.m_ProbesetNames[m_CurrentProbeSetCount]))
00256         {
00257                 Err::errAbort("QuantMethodGTypeCHPReport::reportFailure() - Expecting probeset: " + 
00258                         ToStr(m_Info.m_ProbesetNames[m_CurrentProbeSetCount]) + ToStr(" got: ") +
00259                         ToStr(psGroup.probeSets[0]->name) + " at index: " + ToStr(m_CurrentProbeSetCount));
00260         }
00261 
00262         // Create a blank entry in order to be consistent with psGroups list.
00263         affxchp::CGenotypeProbeSetResults entry;
00264         for (int target=0; target<m_CHPFileNames.size(); target++)
00265         {
00266                 entry.AlleleCall = ALLELE_NO_CALL;
00267                 entry.Confidence = medianOfPmProbes(psGroup, iMart, target);
00268                 entry.RAS1 = 0.0f;
00269                 entry.RAS2 = 0.0f;
00270                 entry.pvalue_AA = 0.0f;
00271                 entry.pvalue_AB = 0.0f;
00272                 entry.pvalue_BB = 0.0f;
00273                 entry.pvalue_NoCall = 0.0f;
00274                 m_GenotypeEntryBufferWriter.WriteGenotypeEntry(target, entry);
00275         }
00276 
00277         m_CurrentProbeSetCount++;
00278 
00279         return true;
00280 }
00281 
00282 /** 
00283  * No more probesets will be processed, this is a chance to finish outputting
00284  * results and clean up.
00285  * @param qMethod - Quantification method that was used.
00286  * @return true if success, false otherwise.
00287  */
00288 bool QuantMethodGTypeCHPReport::finish(QuantMethod &qMethod) 
00289 {
00290         // Sanity to check we saw all the probe sets we were expecting.
00291         if(m_CurrentProbeSetCount != m_Info.m_NumProbeSets) 
00292         {
00293                 Err::errAbort("QuantMethodGTypeCHPReport::finish() - Expecting: " + ToStr(m_Info.m_NumProbeSets) +
00294                         " but got: " + ToStr(m_CurrentProbeSetCount) + ". GCOS XDA CHP file wil be corrupt.");
00295         }
00296 
00297         // Flush remaining signal entries in the buffer.
00298         m_GenotypeEntryBufferWriter.FlushBuffer();
00299 
00300     // Remove .tmp extension
00301         for(unsigned int i = 0; i < m_CHPFileNames.size(); i++) 
00302         {
00303                 std::string orig = m_CHPFileNames[i] + ".tmp";
00304         if(!Fs::fileRename(orig.c_str(),m_CHPFileNames[i].c_str())) {
00305             // Try and remove all the CHP files
00306             Fs::rm(orig, false);
00307                 for(unsigned int j = 0; j < m_CHPFileNames.size(); j++)
00308                     Fs::rm(m_CHPFileNames[j], false);
00309 
00310             Err::errAbort("Unable to rename " + orig + " to " + 
00311                         m_CHPFileNames[i]);
00312         }
00313         }
00314         return true;
00315 }
